Still seeing people I know using the Meitu app, can only show them the risk so many times, this is how identify theft happens :(
@RLewisReports @JacobNWolf Argumentum ad hominem, shame. Good to hear your side of the situation though. pce.
@RLewisReports @JacobNWolf So instead of having a flare we've got to add tags for every pro/team/rioter/CC to RES. Such drama over nothing.
@RLewisReports @JacobNWolf or anyone else involved in the community NOT just rioters. That is the implication im trying to show. /3
@RLewisReports @JacobNWolf than B3 Azir, this just aids that ingestion of information. The same is true for content creators /2
@RLewisReports @JacobNWolf If I'm reading a thread about playing mid and I see a post by Bjerg i'm going to trust its content more /1
@RLewisReports @JacobNWolf when someone who actually knows what theyre talking about is posting.
@RLewisReports @JacobNWolf Personally aside from a few I cant tell one redditor from the other, id like to be able to see more easily /1
@RLewisReports @JacobNWolf I guess I have a trust that it was done genuinely to aid interaction. Maybe I'm wrong. Time will tell.
@RLewisReports @JacobNWolf If you wanna put it that way ok. Its starting with Pros and teams, the exact people is alas out of my control.
@JacobNWolf @RLewisReports Agreed, Id prefer both had it as I've mentioned, visibility of content is awesome. Gotta start somewhere though.
@RLewisReports How that is handled at the time shows a more true reflection of the intent. At least in my opinion.
@RLewisReports Personally I would rather see some interaction with players rather than non. Its open to abuse, any platform is.
@Jedlet123 I fully agree tbh, but it has to start somewhere.
@RLewisReports but if the something gets a reaction like this, then whats the point? /4
@RLewisReports like this? Im not in esports or a CM, these are just my thoughts. Just thinking that something is better than nothing. /3
@RLewisReports enough so it was upped, now because they get something it makes it unfair to start there for reddit to make an action /2
@RLewisReports Personally i'd like to see any pros. But they need to start somewhere. Teams in our leagues get cash, first it wasn’t /1
@RVinceZeSports @RLewisReports Personally I think they would be great for content creators too, I have no input in reddit though. v0v
@RLewisReports Maybe I read it incorrectly, but its appears to be a more focused at players / teams, Rioters are still under the riot flair.
@RLewisReports Does it matter? Potentially boosts engagement and prevents impersonation. I thought that would be a good thing?

Finally finished setting up ELK + Suricata. Creating logstash filters and custom Suricata alert rules. Learning more about certain protocols

@Juliet_Shen @InfosecWomen Np, If you've done basics the Network+ may be suitable for you, if not the A+ is a bit more basic as starter, GL!

@Juliet_Shen @InfosecWomen You can find them for free with the legends over at @cybraryIT ^_^
@Juliet_Shen @InfosecWomen Are a good start, some people dont like them, but depending on your level they can be a good initial step 2/
@Juliet_Shen @InfosecWomen Depending on your level and who you ask you'll get different answers, but the CompTIA A+, Network+, Security+ /1
